meta.format: TOEFL 2026 Write an Email Question Bank

questions.scenario: You are a student at a university. You recently missed an important class because of an illness. You need to email your instructor to explain the situation and ask about making up the missed work.
bullets: Explain why you missed the class
Ask what you should do to catch up
Use a polite and appropriate tone

questions.scenario: You are a student in a university course. An important assignment is due tomorrow, but you have had an unexpected personal situation that has limited your time.
bullets: Ask whether an extension is possible
Maintain a polite and respectful tone

questions.scenario: You are confused about part of an assignment description posted online. You want to make sure you understand the expectations before submitting your work.
bullets: Explain what part of the assignment is unclear
Show that you have already reviewed the instructions

questions.scenario: You are working on a group project. One group member has not been responding to messages, and the deadline is approaching.
bullets: Ask for advice on how to proceed

questions.scenario: Your instructor recently gave you helpful feedback on an assignment. You want to thank them and ask one follow-up question about improving future work.
bullets: Thank the instructor for the feedback
Mention briefly how it helped you

questions.scenario: You want to meet with your instructor during office hours, but the scheduled time conflicts with another class.
bullets: Ask if an alternative meeting time is available
Use a polite and professional tone

questions.scenario: You attempted to submit an assignment online, but the system did not accept your file before the deadline.
bullets: Indicate when you attempted to submit the assignment
Ask what you should do next

questions.scenario: You are halfway through the semester and want feedback on how you are doing in the course.
bullets: Ask for feedback on your progress
Mention one area you are trying to improve

questions.scenario: You are unsure about the course policy on late assignments and want to confirm the rules.
bullets: Ask for clarification about the policy

questions.scenario: You missed a minor assignment deadline because you misunderstood the due date.
Your instructor announced an upcoming exam, but you are unsure about the format.
bullets: Mention what information you already know

questions.scenario: You are applying for a graduate program and would like to ask your instructor for a recommendation letter.
bullets: Politely ask if they would be willing to write a recommendation
Mention the purpose of the letter

questions.scenario: You have been arriving late to class because of a change in your transportation schedule.
bullets: Indicate how you plan to address it

questions.scenario: You would like to record a lecture for study purposes but are unsure if it is allowed.
You received a grade lower than expected on an assignment and want clarification.
You will miss an upcoming class due to a previously scheduled obligation.
You emailed your instructor last week but did not receive a response.
You missed a class and need access to the materials that were discussed.
bullets: Explain why you missed the class
Ask how to access the materials

questions.scenario: You want to know if there are any opportunities to earn extra credit in the course.
bullets: Accept that the answer may be no

questions.scenario: You recently added a course late and want to confirm that your registration is complete.
bullets: Ask if you are fully enrolled
